name: Pavilions Hotel

reviews.text: We were billeted here as our first stop on a Lions tour.
reviews.title: Ok for the summer, cold in winter
Hated the Pavilions Feb 2005
reviews.text: Rooms were ok size but only one heater to cope with the whole room. Shower room was not heated and therefore very cold in the morning.

reviews.title: Very average in parts, and below average in others
reviews.text: We arrived in Christchurch on a Sunday afternoon (visa run!) and checked into the Pavilions. First impressions were ok, the pool and spa look absolutely nothing like they do in the pictures, but then you've got to admire the photographer! We were told at reception that there would be someone on the desk 24 hours a day if we needed anything at all and shown to our room. We were given a free upgrade to an Executive room as we were staying 5 nights which we were thankful for.

We went out to explore a bit of Christchurch centre, and came back at about 9.30pm, quite hungry after our walk and our flight. We thought we'd just grab something off the 24 hour snack menu. So we went to the bar to be told by a pretty rude older guy that we could have a toasted sandwich but he'd "have to get someone to watch the bar". The kitchen is located directly behind the bar, the bar itself is about 1.5 metres long, and there were 2 other people in the bar itself (both of whom seemed to be friendly with the guy, ie...his mates). We thought, fine, what's the problem then? He didn't seem to want to shift so instead we went back out to find something. Unfortunately everything seems to shut pretty early in Christchurch on a Sunday...it's more like a village than a city! We thought we'd get a quick burger from Burger King across the road considering nothing else was open, alas, by then it was 10pm and that too was shut.
reviews.title: Central Location and service with a smile!!

likes.liked: — How welcome you were made to feel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up going to bed with nothing to eat and no help from the "24 hour" room service/snack menu.
reviews.title: Affordadable and convenient, can't ask for more

likes.disliked: — hotel restaurant structured for group tours, must submit meal order before seating

reviews.title: Modern and stark
reviews.text: We decided that we wouldn't eat in the hotel after this experience, other than for the free "continental" breakfast which came as part of the deal. To be honest it's pretty dire.... a basket of toast (although plenty of it) which is your supermarket saver brand, a selection of juice and cereal, tinned fruit and yoghurt. It was ok, and it was free..... but at $16 per person which it stipulates on the menu, I would NEVER have paid that. We didn't try the cooked breakfast so I couldn't say about that.

We decided to go to the nearby supermarket on Papanui road in Merivale which is about a 20 minute walk and buy a few things to keep in the minibar fridge to make sandwiches for our lunch for the next few days, we weren't sure what would be around so thought this was the best bet! So we were thankful for the free room upgrade which gave us a few kitchen accessories, pots, pans, plates, cutlery etc.
reviews.title: Loved every aspect!!

description: Pavilions Hotel is conveniently located near the central city. We have 86 beautifully designed and appointed guest rooms and we can provide rooms with full kitchen, spa bath and disabled facilities. Just 7 km from the airport and 2 minutes from Hagley Park, it makes golfing and our famous Botanical Gardens just outside our doorstep.
